_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: AutoPlug Minecraft
author: major@ytmajor.com
description: AutoPlug is an automatic plugin and server updater.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# AutoPlug & Game Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server
apt update
apt install -y curl jq
apt install -y wget
#
#
# Check for AutoPlug directory.
#
#
echo -e "Checking for AutoPlug directory."
if [ ! -d "/autoplug/" ]; then
echo -e "AutoPlug directory not found, making one."
mkdir autoplug
fi
echo -e "Checking for Mods directory."
if [ ! -d "/mods/" ]; then
echo -e "Mods directory not found, making one."
mkdir mods
fi
echo -e "Checking for Plugins directory."
if [ ! -d "/plugins/" ]; then
echo -e "Plugins directory not found, making one."
mkdir plugins
fi
#
#
# Install AutoPlug
#
#
echo -e "Installing AutoPlug..."
if [ ! -f ${AUTOPLUG_JARFILE} ]; then
wget -O AutoPlug-Client.jar https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Osiris-Team/AutoPlug-Releases/master/stable-builds/AutoPlug-Client.jar
else
echo -e "AutoPlug already installed! Resuming..."
fi
#
#
# Install Server Files
#
#
echo -e "Downloading server.properties"
wget -O server.properties https://raw.githubusercontent.com/parkervcp/eggs/master/minecraft/java/server.properties
echo -e "Downloading AutoPlug's general.yml config"
wget -O autoplug/general.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ImLunaUwU/PteroPlug/main/general.yml
echo -e "Downloading AutoPlug's updater.yml config..."
wget -O autoplug/updater.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ImLunaUwU/PteroPlug/main/updater.yml
echo -e "Downloading start script..."
wget -O start.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ImLunaUwU/PteroPlug/main/start.sh
#
#
# Minecraft Server Software
#
#
if [ ${SERVER_TYPE} = "purpur" ]; then # Purpur, my beloved.
echo -e "Downloading Purpur server..."
wget -O ${SERVER_TYPE}.jar https://api.purpurmc.org/v2/purpur/${GAME_VERSION}/latest/download
#
#
#
elif [ ${SERVER_TYPE} = "paper" ]; then # Paper :/ Just use Purpur, please.
echo -e "Downloading Paper server..."
# Get the build number and game version of the most recent build
latest_build="$(curl -sX GET https://papermc.io/api/v2/projects/paper/version_group/${GAME_VERSION}/builds -H 'accept: application/json' | jq '.builds [-1].build')"
correct_version="$(curl -sX GET https://papermc.io/api/v2/projects/paper/version_group/${GAME_VERSION}/builds -H 'accept: application/json' | jq '.builds [-1].version')"
fix_version="${correct_version%\"}"
fix_version="${fix_version#\"}"
# Construct download URL
download_url="https://papermc.io/api/v2/projects/paper/versions/"$fix_version"/builds/"$latest_build"/downloads/paper-"$fix_version"-"$latest_build".jar"
# Download file
wget -O ${SERVER_TYPE}.jar "$download_url"
#
#
#
elif [ ${SERVER_TYPE} = "spigot" ]; then # Spigot :/ Again, why not use Purpur?.
echo -e "Downloading Spigot server..."
wget -O ${SERVER_TYPE}.jar https://download.getbukkit.org/spigot/spigot-${GAME_VERSION}.jar
echo -e "It is recommended that you switch to Purpur. It has better performance and is updated more often."
fi
#
#
# PteroPlug - AutoPlug Pterodactyl Egg by Luna
# https://lunauwu.net/ https://github.com/ImLunaUwU/PteroPlug
#
# AutoPlug by Osiris
# https://autoplug.one/
#
# Purpur by the Purpur Team
# https://purpurmc.org/
#
# Paper by the Paper Team
# https://papermc.io/
#
# Spigot by the Spigot Team
# https://www.spigotmc.org/
#
#

variables.name: AutoPlug Jar File
variables.description: The name of the jarfile to run AutoPlug.

variables.name: Server Type
variables.description:
Must be "purpur", "paper" or "spigot".
If more server types are needed, please message LunaUwU#6969

variables.name: AutoPlug Server Key
variables.description:
The key of your server. 
Needed if you want to use the panel on https://autoplug.one/

variables.name: Game Version
variables.description:
Minecraft Version
Formats:
Purpur, Spigot: 1.x.x
Paper: 1.x

variables.name: Java Launch Arguments
variables.description:
Custom Java arguments.
Default value has the recommended settings for a server running Purpur.
